Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is unnecessary as ACMA's role should remain focused on protecting people from scams and false claims.
The legislation would give ACMA excessive power to decide what is right or wrong, limiting free expression and debate.
Fact checkers have been shown to flag or remove posts based on differing opinions, which is problematic.
The government is portrayed as the largest source of misinformation, and the proposal would unjustly limit public expression while allowing government narratives to go unchecked.
Notable Quotes: This proposal is basically saying that apart from government and government agencies, nobody else is allowed to have and express an opinion.
The past 3 years have provided abundant proof that the government is the largest single source of the most harmful dis/misinformation.
